# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/urllib3/packages/six.py
@source-hash: 6fd2ccd30057bfb1
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:58:18Z

## Purpose
This is the Six library - a Python 2 and 3 compatibility utility that provides a unified interface for writing code that runs on both Python versions. It handles differences in module locations, function names, string types, and other incompatibilities between Python 2 and 3.

## Core Components

### Version Detection (L36-38)
- `PY2`, `PY3`, `PY34`: Boolean flags for Python version detection
- Used throughout to conditionally define platform-specific behavior

### Type Compatibility (L40-53)
- `string_types`, `integer_types`, `class_types`: Tuples of compatible types for both Python versions
- `text_type`, `binary_type`: Unified string type abstractions
- `MAXSIZE`: Platform-appropriate maximum size value

### Lazy Loading Infrastructure

#### `_LazyDescr` (L91-105)
Base class for lazy attribute resolution using descriptor protocol. Replaces itself after first access to avoid repeated lookups.

#### `MovedModule` (L107-125)
Lazy loader for entire modules that moved between Python versions. Resolves to correct module name based on Python version.

#### `MovedAttribute` (L141-163)
Lazy loader for individual attributes/functions that moved between modules or changed names.

#### `_LazyModule` (L127-139)
Base class for creating module-like objects with lazy attribute loading.

### Import System Integration

#### `_SixMetaPathImporter` (L165-238)
PEP 302 meta path importer that intercepts imports of `six.moves.*` modules. Implements finder/loader protocol with methods:
- `find_module()` (L185): Locate modules in known_modules registry
- `load_module()` (L201): Load and return module instances
- `is_package()` (L215): Determine if module is a package

### Moves Implementation

#### `_MovedItems` (L243-248)
Main `six.moves` module containing all moved Python 2/3 items.

#### Moved Attributes Registry (L250-333)
Comprehensive list of attributes/modules that moved between Python versions:
- Standard library modules (builtins, configparser, etc.)
- Individual functions (filter, map, range, etc.)
- urllib submodules with specialized classes (L352-541)

### Function/Method Compatibility (L560-635)
- Method attribute name mappings (`_meth_func`, `_func_code`, etc.)
- Function introspection utilities (`get_method_function`, `get_function_code`)
- Iterator compatibility (`advance_iterator`, `next`)

### Dictionary Iteration (L637-682)
Version-specific functions for dict iteration:
- `iterkeys`, `itervalues`, `iteritems`: Unified iteration interface
- `viewkeys`, `viewvalues`, `viewitems`: Dict view objects

### String/Bytes Handling (L684-743)
- `b()`, `u()`: Byte/unicode literal constructors
- `StringIO`, `BytesIO`: Unified string/bytes IO classes
- Test assertion method name mappings

### Exception Handling (L761-812)
- `reraise()` (L764/L789): Cross-version exception re-raising
- `raise_from()` (L801/L810): Exception chaining support

### Print Function (L814-884)
Backport of Python 3 print function for Python 2 with full feature compatibility including file parameter and flush support.

### Metaclass Support (L929-971)
- `with_metaclass()` (L929): Create classes with metaclasses across Python versions
- `add_metaclass()` (L953): Class decorator for metaclass application

### String Coercion (L973-1031)
- `ensure_binary()`, `ensure_str()`, `ensure_text()`: Safe string type conversion
- `python_2_unicode_compatible()` (L1033): Decorator for unicode-compatible classes

### Module Setup (L1052-1076)
- Package configuration and meta path importer registration
- Cleanup of conflicting six importers from previous imports
